gobblin.source.extractor.hadoop

Class OldApiHadoopFileInputExtractor<S,D,K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.source.extractor.hadoop.OldApiHadoopFileInputExtractor<S,D,K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - output schema type
    D - output data record type that MUST be compatible with either # or #
    K - key type expected by the RecordReader
    V - value type expected by the RecordReader
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    gobblin.source.extractor.Extractor<S,D>, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    OldApiWritableFileExtractor

    public abstract class OldApiHadoopFileInputExtractor<S,D,K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
implements gobblin.source.extractor.Extractor<S,D>
    An implementation of Extractor that uses a Hadoop RecordReader to read records from a FileSplit.

    This class is equivalent to HadoopFileInputExtractor in terms of functionality except that it uses the old Hadoop API.

    This class can read either keys of type # or values of type # using the given RecordReader, depending on the value of the second argument of the constructor OldApiHadoopFileInputExtractor(RecordReader, boolean). It will read keys if the argument is true, otherwise it will read values. Normally, this is specified using the property HadoopFileInputSource.FILE_INPUT_READ_KEYS_KEY, which is false by default.

    This class provides a default implementation of readRecord(Object) that simply casts the keys or values read by the RecordReader into type #. It is required that type # or # can be safely casted to type #.

    The Hadoop RecordReader is passed into this class, which is responsible for closing it by calling RecordReader.close() in close().

    A concrete implementation of this class should at least implement the Extractor.getSchema() method.
